com.firebase.jobdispatcher

Class FirebaseJobDispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.firebase.jobdispatcher.FirebaseJobDispatcher

  • public final class FirebaseJobDispatcher
extends java.lang.Object
    The FirebaseJobDispatcher provides a driver-agnostic API for scheduling and cancelling Jobs.
    See Also:
    FirebaseJobDispatcher(Driver), Driver, JobParameters

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  FirebaseJobDispatcher.CancelResult
      Results that can legally be returned from cancel(String) or cancelAll() calls.
      static class  FirebaseJobDispatcher.ScheduleFailedException
      Thrown when a schedule(com.firebase.jobdispatcher.Job) call fails.
      static interface  FirebaseJobDispatcher.ScheduleResult
      Results that can legally be returned from schedule(Job) calls.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CANCEL_RESULT_NO_DRIVER_AVAILABLE
      Indicates the cancel request failed because the driver was unavailable.
      static int CANCEL_RESULT_SUCCESS
      Indicates the cancel request seems to have been successful.
      static int CANCEL_RESULT_UNKNOWN_ERROR
      Indicates the cancel request encountered an unknown error.
      static int SCHEDULE_RESULT_BAD_SERVICE
      Indicates the schedule request failed because the service is not exposed or configured correctly.
      static int SCHEDULE_RESULT_NO_DRIVER_AVAILABLE
      Indicates the schedule request failed because the driver was unavailable.
      static int SCHEDULE_RESULT_SUCCESS
      Indicates the schedule request seems to have been successful.
      static int SCHEDULE_RESULT_UNKNOWN_ERROR
      Indicates the schedule request encountered an unknown error.
      static int SCHEDULE_RESULT_UNSUPPORTED_TRIGGER
      Indicates the schedule request failed because the Trigger was unsupported.

      Constructor and Description
      FirebaseJobDispatcher(Driver driver)
      Instantiates a new FirebaseJobDispatcher using the provided Driver.

      int cancel(java.lang.String tag)
      Attempts to cancel the Job that matches the provided tag and endpoint.

      Attempts to cancel all Jobs registered for this package.

      Returns a ValidationEnforcer configured for the current Driver.

      Attempts to schedule the provided Job, throwing an exception if it fails.

    • Method Detail

      • schedule

        public int schedule(Job job)
        Attempts to schedule the provided Job.

        Returns one of the SCHEDULE_RESULT_ constants.

      • cancel

        public int cancel(java.lang.String tag)
        Attempts to cancel the Job that matches the provided tag and endpoint.

        Returns one of the CANCEL_RESULT_ constants.

      • cancelAll

        public int cancelAll()
        Attempts to cancel all Jobs registered for this package.

        Returns one of the CANCEL_RESULT_ constants.

      • mustSchedule

        public void mustSchedule(Job job)
        Attempts to schedule the provided Job, throwing an exception if it fails.
        Throws:
        FirebaseJobDispatcher.ScheduleFailedException

      • getValidator

        public ValidationEnforcer getValidator()
        Returns a ValidationEnforcer configured for the current Driver.

      • newJobBuilder

        public Job.Builder newJobBuilder()
        Creates a new Job.Builder, configured with the current driver's validation settings.

      • newRetryStrategy

        public RetryStrategy newRetryStrategy(int policy,
                                      int initialBackoff,
                                      int maximumBackoff)
        Creates a new RetryStrategy from the provided parameters, validated with the current driver's JobValidator.
        Parameters:
        policy - the backoff policy to use. One of the RetryStrategy.RetryPolicy constants.
        initialBackoff - the initial backoff, in seconds.
        maximumBackoff - the maximum backoff, in seconds.
        Throws:
        ValidationEnforcer.ValidationException
        See Also:
        RetryStrategy
